resources.string: Airplane mode automatically disables all radios on your device when it is toggled. We can specify which radios should be disabled (such as keeping WiFi on when enabling airplane mode). Also, we can change which radios can be toggled manually when the device enters airplane mode.

Under the \"secure lock settings\", you can set an \"automatically lock\" timer. This timer determines how long after the device enters sleep mode that the lock screen should be displayed. Through this option, we can see whatever value (in seconds) that we want. If you set a high enough value, then essentially your lock screen will never show (provided you have disabled the \"power button instantly locks device\" feature).
Set Custom Battery Saver Trigger Percent
Google\'s Battery Saver feature can automatically trigger when the battery level is at 5\% or 15\%. With this, you can set your own trigger percent.

In Accessibility settings, there\'s a feature called \"touch & hold delay\" which allows you to specify how long you have to hold down on the screen for Android to recognize a long-press event. However, the only options by default are \"short\", “medium\", and \"long.\" We can set our own delay.

Android allows you to set the size of the text shown on your device by specifying a system-wide font scale. This value is typically represented as \"small\", \"normal\", \"large\", \"huge\", and \"extra huge.\" However, we can set our own custom value.
Whether to enable freeform multiwindow support. Requires reboot. Only works on Android 7.0+ devices.

Default app install location. Choose which storage apps are installed to by default. Normally, apps themselves decide by specifying the value in the AndroidManifest, but we can choose to have them install to the adoptable storage medium if we want.
Toggle to globally enable or disable heads up notifications. Heads up notifications are the notifications that pop up at the top of the screen.

When your device reaches a certain threshold value of available storage, Android displays a warning that your device has insufficient amounts of storage available. This can prevent you from installing new apps or updates. We can manually lower the threshold value to prevent this warning from showing.
Keep the Device On when Plugged In

In Android\'s Developer Settings, you can select the option to keep the screen on when plugged into power. By default, this enables the feature for all power sources. We can specify which power sources we want to have our phone\'s screen to stay on.
In Android\'s Developer Settings, you can set animation scales to control the duration of animations. If the available options are too fast or slow for you, we can set custom values here.
Lock Screen Orientation to Custom Value

Most phones only allow you to lock your phone\'s screen orientation to Portrait mode. With this setting, we can lock screen orientation to any orientation. You will first have to disable auto-rotate before this will work.

Most other applications that allow you to toggle immersive mode only have a few options: hide the navigation bar or hide the status bar. It is actually possible to set immersive mode to hide either/or the navigation bar or status bar on a per-app basis, however.
Milliseconds after a heads up notification is pushed back before the app can interrupt again. (Default: 60 seconds).
Enabling this may allow your phone to quickly launch the camera by double tapping the power button or flipping the phone between back and front.

EU regulations require smartphones to warn when going above certain volume levels (85dB). This warning must be shown once after every reboot or after 20 hours of continuous music playback. The warning must be dismissed by the user manually, but through hidden commands we can automatically bypass the warning.
On some devices and Android versions, this may bypass carrier restrictions on tethering.
When sending SMS to certain short codes, the system warns you that you may be charged a fee. This feature can be globally disabled with this key.

By default, Android limits you to sending 30 SMS every 30 minutes before bothering you with a pop-up notification. Using these two values, we can customize however many SMS we want to be able to send without being bothered.
Audio that is played when the phone is docked in a car dock.
Audio that is played when the phone is removed from a car dock.
Audio that is played when the phone is docked in a desk dock.
Audio that is played when the phone is removed from a desk dock.
Audio that is played when the phone is locked.
Audio that is played when the device is unlocked.
Audio that is played when the device is at low battery.
Audio that is played when the device enters the “trusted” state without unlocking.
Audio that is played when the device is being charged wirelessly.
Whether to disable the sound that plays when the device begins charging.
Root wasn\'t detected. If your device is rooted, make sure Tweaker has root access. Otherwise, press the HELP button for ADB instructions.

Your Android device probably has a lot of settings to change, but did you know there\'s a lot of settings that are hidden? This app helps you change those hidden settings! You don\'t need root access, but you do have to follow a few steps to set this app up.

Tweaker needs a special permission to work. To grant it, you either need to use ADB or be rooted. Pressing GRANT below will attempt to use root to grant the permission. Otherwise, hit the HELP button, and we\'ll help you get ADB set up. Don\'t worry, though; ADB is perfectly safe to use. You won\'t void your warranty, trip Samsung Knox, root your phone, or unlock the bootloader.
Follow us on Twitter for the latest updates.\nLeave a comment on the XDA Forums for any feedback.\nAnd last but not least, leave a rating on the Play Store if you like this app!
Sorry, this feature only works with Android %s and later
Sorry, this feature only works from Android %1$s to Android %2$s
Sorry, this feature only works through Android %s
